intro: Pteropogon humboldtianus, commonly known as the Humboldt's gudgeon, is a small freshwater fish native to the rivers of South America. It belongs to the family Cyprinidae and is characterized by its slender body and distinctive coloration. The species is typically found in clear, flowing waters with rocky substrates. It feeds primarily on small invertebrates and plant matter, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to habitat degradation, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
